page.title: 10The village of Lullington
page.content: Lullington is a small nucleated village situated in the quiet rural backwaters of S.Derbyshire. The 1981 census recorded a population of 123 but this figure was once much higher. In 1851 there was a population of 303. In fact it was an estate village and much of the present day structure is a result of the villagers dependence on the employment provided by Lullington Hall and its farms. Several of the buildings in Lullington relate to it's history. Lullington Hall stables were converted into an elegant detached house in 1967. Other buildings retain exterior brickwork indicating their original function. For example the blacksmith's and wheelwright's cottage. In fact it appears to have been an almost self sufficient village.
